fact_check_explanation_summary: Doctors only report a small fraction of Covid infections through the NOIDs system.

fact_check_explanation_title: The time on Boris Johnson’s watch does not prove his televised address wasn’t live
fact_check_explanation_summary: The watch appears upside down to the viewer, but shows 8pm.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government has awarded a contract to develop technology that proves you’ve recently had a negative Covid-19 test
fact_check_explanation_summary: This doesn’t mean that vaccination passports are planned.

fact_check_explanation_title: 2020, the year QAnon aligned with the UK’s fears
fact_check_explanation_summary: Conspiracies that have come to define QAnon in 2020, such as distrust of authority and vaccine scepticism, have always been a big part of UK conspiracy culture.

fact_check_explanation_title: The needles in some syringes are supposed to ‘disappear’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some syringes have a spring which retracts the needle once the dose is administered.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some on the Pfizer vaccine trials did get Bell’s palsy, but not more than we’d expect by chance
fact_check_explanation_summary: Four volunteers developed Bell’s palsy after getting a Covid-19 vaccine, but this doesn’t mean they are linked.

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no evidence the Pfizer vaccine interferes with the placenta
fact_check_explanation_summary: One expert said the possibility was ‘vanishingly small’.

fact_check_explanation_title: PPE: What actually happened during the first wave?
fact_check_explanation_summary: FOI data from NHS trusts reveals the central supply chain used data that didn’t always show the picture on the ground when sending out PPE stock.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can we believe the lockdown sceptics?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Evidence does not support the theories of sceptics Peter Hitchens, Ivor Cummins and Mike Yeadon

fact_check_explanation_title: How to check claims about tariffs and trade
fact_check_explanation_summary: Knowing which tariffs to pay and what rules to follow is vital for businesses. Misinformation about tariff rates can be used to mislead the public. Here’s how to understand what’s …

fact_check_explanation_title: Survey doesn’t show voters ditching Conservatives over bike lanes
fact_check_explanation_summary: A survey by the campaign group Fair Fuel UK was covered by The Mail on Sunday, but has several flaws.

fact_check_explanation_title: The problem with coronavirus transmission in hospitals
fact_check_explanation_summary: Full Fact investigates what we know about Covid-19 transmission in hospitals, and what we don’t.
